oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from Confederate soldier John Lafayette Lemonds
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Writing to his future wife M. [Ellen] McCorkle following the Battle of Shiloh, 1st Lt. John L. Lemonds of Co. C, 5th Inf. CSA, a unit recruited largely from Henry County, notes her distress with "the depredations of the federals." Recuperating from; illness at his uncle's, he writes of re-joining his regiment the day after the battle: "it was indeed a sad spectacle one I hope never again to witness�the most painful scene I ever beheld." Signed "Your affect[ionate] Lover, Fayette."
